WorkItem.Description:
The evaluate upgrade option for each individual piece of gear, currently only scans through the equipped item and not all of the available ones.
Â 
Build: 36187

Comments.Message: Can you explain more? I don't get what you're saying.

Open Rawr.
Open a Character.
Right click an equipped item. (For this we'll say Main Hand, as there's no set bonuses to worry about).
Go to Evaluate Upgrade.
Runs for about 2 seconds, using the name of your current weapon only, where it should run through all available weapons.
Returns nothing.

Attached a screenshot to show that there are better weapons, not only available in the list, but also to the optimizer.
That is not what evaluate upgrade is. It specifically looks just how much of an upgrade that specific item is. It does not evaluate all items for that slot.
Why would it tell you how much an upgrade it is, if you're already wearing it?

It's intended for use on an item that you're NOT wearing.  For example, say I'm wearing a Betrayer of Humanity as an Arms Warrior.  I want to know how much of an upgrade getting Lotrafen would be.  I would right-click Lotrafen and select "Evaluate Upgrade" for that once slot.

To Build and Upgrade List by going through all items, go to the optimizer, and the bottom right side should have the button you are looking for.
So then you should gray out the option, like equip is, on equipped items.
No, evaluating upgrade for currently equipped item still makes sense if you want to see if there is a better gemming/enchant combination.
